intro: Trillidium japonicum, commonly known as Japanese trillidium, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Trillidium japonicum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
